snippet: Tax returns and divorce decrees may be useful to keep for a lifetime, but many financial documents can be stored on a flash drive, or even destroyed.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column gives suggestions about saving, or getting rid of, tax records and other financial documents.
lead_paragraph: Tax returns and divorce decrees may be useful to keep for a lifetime, but many financial documents can be stored on a flash drive, or even destroyed.

headline.print_headline: Tax Documents: What to Shred, and What to Keep
headline.main: Tax Documents: What to Shred, and What to Keep
